Class Objective

java.lang.Object
  Objective

public class Objective
extends java.lang.Object

A model of a camera dedicated to the autofocus-exercise. The camera has a fixed number of focus-steps. The constructor initializes each focus-step with a fixed contrast value (the test data). The class simulates the fact that moving the lens has an effect on the contrast.

Field Summary
protected  double[] contrast
          The test data, stores contrast values for all lens-positions
protected  byte focusPos
          The current position of the lens

Constructor Detail

Objective

public Objective()
Default constructor uses some default data to initialize the camera

Objective

public Objective(byte numberOfSteps,
                 byte contrastMaxPos,
                 byte initPos)
This constructor uses the given data to initialize the camera. Makes sure that contrastMaxPos and initPos are smaller than numberOfSteps.

Parameters:
numberOfSteps - the number of possible lens-positions
contrastMaxPos - the lens-position where the contrast maximum should reside
initPos - the initial lens-position
